overview.summary: COMP 215 at Rice University provides a foundational understanding of object-oriented programming using Java, emphasizing design principles and patterns.
learningObjectives: Understand core concepts of object-oriented programming
Design and implement Java programs using OOP principles
Apply software design patterns to solve programming problems
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code

difficultyFactors: Steep learning curve for OOP concepts
Emphasis on design and code quality
recommendedPreparation: Prior experience with any programming language

professors.teachingStyle: Combination of lectures, hands-on coding exercises, and group projects
professors.availability: Regular office hours, responsive to emails, typically accessible via Piazza

statistics.enrollmentTrend: Stable; consistently high demand due to its foundational nature

careerProspects.salaryImpact: Significant positive impact on starting salaries for graduates

bestFor: Students who enjoy hands-on programming projects
studyTips: Seek help from TAs and professor
recommendations.timeManagement: Prioritize assignments and dedicate sufficient time for coding and studying

uniqueAspects: Focus on design patterns and software architecture
Strong emphasis on code quality and testing
successFactors: Active participation in class and labs
